column4: i am currently running(not succesfully) kernel 2.6.28.3.1-rt (realtime(, anybody know how i could install a previous rt??
older versions are in synpatic/repos you need to change your policy
try it without the real time kernel
try to narrow it down
define crash
it reboots on it's own ? that sounds like a hardware error
any error with any hardware
that doesn't mean it's not a hardware problem
that means nothing in reality
that doesn't mean anything
look up a livecd called "Stress Linux" see if that works or how hard you can stress it
again that sounds like a hardware issue,
a OS crash would put stuff on screen normally
i have burned this "stress linux" but when i boot from it, after a few screens of text it ends wit "kernel panic - no syncing: attempted to kill init!"
interesting,
what could that mean?
well, it depends what's not syncing, that's normally a complain about disk devices, but there are other options
can you get a few lines above that error ?
can we maybe talk in private about this, difficult to find all the messages between everyone elses talk
yeah, hang on
i know you said it would take min. 8 hours, but it seems to be ready
told me a "memtest" would take a minimum of 8 hours to finish, but it only took 1hour16minutes, anybody got a clue on this?
you there?
